bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Pathological Condition identical with chi you dan du 赤游丹毒 , red roaming cinnabar poison. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Substance Entry yun tai 芸薹 quotes SSM : 貞觀七年三月，予在內江縣飲多，至夜 覺四體骨肉疼痛。至曉頭痛，額角有丹如彈丸，腫痛。至午通腫，目不 能開。經日幾斃。予思本草芸薹治風游丹腫，遂取葉搗傅，隨手即消， 其驗如神也。亦可搗汁服之 , “During the zhen guan reign period I was in Neijian country where I drank a lot. At night I felt pain in the bones and flesh of all four extremities. At dawn my head ached. On one of my temples I had a cinnabar [poisoning] resembling a bullet. It was swollen and painful. At noon the entire region was swollen, and I could no longer open my eyes. After several days I came close to dying. Then I recalled that the Ben cao lists yun tai to cure wind roaming cinnabar [poison] swelling. I took its leaves, ground them and smeared [the pulp onto the affected region. The swelling] disappeared immediately. A miraculous effect, indeed. It is also possible to pound it to a juice for internal ingestion”. The term feng you dan zhong 風游丹腫 , wind roaming cinnabar swelling, appears in the subsequent section Fu fang 附方 , Additional Recipes, modified to: chi you dan du 赤火丹毒 , red fire cinnabar poison .
